ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
First or second fMRI session (e.g. fmri1, fmri2)
Task version
Notes: 1 = Shock; 2 = Reward-gain; 3= Reward-loss; 4 = Version 1; 5 = Version 2; 6= Version 3

ElementDescription: Did block involve volatile or stable condition?
Trial number within a block
Time since beginning of experiment (ms) to presentation of options in the current trial
Time since beginning of experiment (ms) to onset of response period in the current trial
Time since beginning of experiment (ms) to response in the current trial
Time since beginning of experiment (ms) to outcome presentation in the current trial
Time since beginning of experiment (ms) to onset of inter-trial interval at the end of the current trial
Description of stimulus 1 (e.g. cross, triangle, square, circle)
Description of stimulus 2 (e.g. cross, triangle, square, circle)
On which side was stim1 presented
Magnitude of stim1
Magnitude of stim2
Selected stimulus option
On which side was the selected option located?
Notes: 1 = Left, chose left shape; 2 = Right, chose right shape

ElementDescription: Response randomly selected by the computer due to timeout
Notes: 1 = Computer made the choice; 0 = Participant made the choice

ElementDescription: Information whether stim1 is associated with a non-zero outcome on the current trial
Notes: 1 = Stim1 results in the non-zero outcome; 0 = Stim2 results in the non-zero outcome. Non-zero outcome = reward or shock receipt

ElementDescription: Final outcome of a trial
Notes: 1 = Non-zero outcome (reward/shock received); 0 = Zero outcome (reward/shock not received)

ElementDescription: Response time (ms)
Timepoint/visit label
Trial number
Equipment Manufacturer
Stimulation target
fMRI series number
Age in Years
Magnitude of stimulation current
Stimulation pulse width
Stimulation pulse frequency
Duration of fMRI discarded to achieve steady state
Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: What is your ethnicity:
Notes: 1=Hispanic or Latino; 2=Not Hispanic or Latino; 3=Unknown or not reported
